fields.summary: TiAPI: Review and clean up platform bugs and reduce bug count by 20%.

fields.description:
{html}

Android SDK: Titanium Developer, Run Emulator, "Screen" menu shows "Loading..." while "SDK" menu displays OK.

See following screenshot:

Also, see hi-res screenshot here

The problem exists when the exact android packages are installed as in the screenshot. This has been proven a problem on Windows 7 and Ubuntu (by me) and Mac OSX 10.6.5 (by dtoth).

Workaround that resolves this completely is to close TiDev, install the package, "SDK Platform Android 1.5" and start TiDev and launch the app.

{html}
fields.summary: Android SDK: Titanium Developer, Run Emulator, "Screen" menu shows "Loading..." while "SDK" menu displays OK

comments.body:
{html}

Note, when this bug is resolved, the "SDK Platform Android 1.5" may be uninstalled.

{html}

{html}

For users who may be confused by the workaround, "SDK Platform Android 1.5" can be installed using the Android SDK and AVD Manager tool (shown in the top-left of the screenshot above):

  • close all emulators
  • close Titanium Developer
  • install the "SDK Platform Android 1.5..." package
  • delete existing AVDs using the same tool as you installed the package
  • start Titanium Developer
  • launch app
{html}

{html}

I had similar problem once I've put "Android SDK path" in Profile with trailing space in it - profile was saved successfully, but Developer was unable to load SDK list and showed "loading" forever.

{html}

{html}

The same issue is with my development too. I don't get SDK list and also Screen list showed "loading...". Let me know if you have resolved the above issue you got. It would be helpful. Thanks. All the steps are properly followed as given in installation pdf file.

{html}

{html}

I've had similar problem, path to Android SDK didn't have trailing slash, I've added trailing slash and problem was solved. I guess the problem is with Android SDK path and trailing slash.

Ivan

{html}

{html}

I have the same issue, on Windows 7 (x64)... I've tried a few things include moving the Android sdk folder between the program files and program files (x86) folders, but no luck (obviously updated the titanium sdk path and environment variables each time).

Still says "Loading...", so annoying.

I run Process Monitor and noticed Titanium developer was looking for the file "QUSEREX.DLL" in the sdk tools folder, obviously this doesn't exist (I've heard it's known to be used for hacking and searching for specific files), any ideas on this?

Many thanks,
Ryan (droidexposure)

{html}

{html}

Further to my question about the odd "QUSEREX.DLL", here's a screen shot (attached) a link for security information on it... http://tinyurl.com/4rovfn8

Just a little bit scary...

{html}
We no longer support Titanium Developer, please download and use Titanium Studio instead. Ticket marked as invalid.
